content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem, rules are clear.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea, clear description. Great practice task, solvable in 15 minutes even with small coding experience.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple, solvable problem that can be tackled in less than 5 minutes, this an excellent simple ad-hoc challenge for developers.

Goal
* Please delete the line break after "[[n]]".

* Please explain which answer to choose when there are multiple possible answers.

Note: You CANNOT state "print any of them" as only the answers the author has provided are the answers accepted as correct for a clash on CodinGame.

Input
* Please change "The first line contains" to "<<Line 1>>:" (<< >> is the syntax for bold format).

* Please change "The second line contains" to "<<Line 2>>:".

* Please format "A" and "O" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please move the last sentence "It is guaranteed (etc)" to Constraints section.

Output
* Please change "such that," to "such that all the restrictions described in the statement are satisfied".

* Please delete ", each of you and your brother get at least one fruit, your number of apples is different from your brother's, and your number of oranges is different from your brother's. If there are several possible answers, print any of them."

* Please format "-1" as a {{constant}} instead of as a [[variable]].

Constraints
* Please change "[[n]](2≤n≤200)" to "2 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 200".

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar and *not the same*. Please revise the cases.

Title
* Suggest to change the title from "Food" to "Sharing fruit".

Thanks.

I like the idea of the puzzle.

I am not sure if I understood the restrictions correctly. However, I think the solution for the first test case should be 3.

1: A--AAO
2: AA--AO
3: AAA-O
I mentioned in the output section : (smallest value of k) when there are multiple possible answers. So it should be 1 not 3
Thank you for you insights I will make sure to apply them !

Thank you for making the changes. A few more issues to follow up:

Goal
* Please explain which answer to choose when there are multiple possible answers.

Note: You CANNOT state "Find any correct division" as only the answers the author has provided are the answers accepted as correct for a clash on CodinGame.

Input
* Line 2: Please add "[[s]]" after "a string".

Constraints
* Please change "this string" to "[[s]]".

Cases
* Please add additional pairs of cases so that the answers are not limited to 1 and -1.

Thanks again.
I have done as you requested. As for the answer i clarified in the output (leftmost valid division).
